Posted By: ToAsTy42o (4/29/2012 4:33:00 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The card is great in limited, but it lacks in comparison to other black removal of this type:  
To give a creature -1/-1 it cost 2cmc, [tragic slip](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=tragic slip) is better at 1cmc  
To give -2/-2, its cost 3cmc, [disfigure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=disfigure) is better at 1cmc  
-3/-3 at 4cmc, [urge to feed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=urge to feed) is better at 2cmc, even with out the tribal effect  
at this point [dismember](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=dismember) is just better over all.  
Again, this is a decent card, molds to your situation and anything that kills indestructible is good in my book, but there are other, much faster options.
posts.html:
The card is great in limited, but it lacks in comparison to other black removal of this type:

-3/-3 at 4cmc, urge to feed is better at 2cmc, even with out the tribal effect
at this point dismember is just better over all.
Again, this is a decent card, molds to your situation and anything that kills indestructible is good in my book, but there are other, much faster options.

Posted By: Salient (5/28/2012 1:47:34 PM)

posts.post_content:
EDIT: To clarify my previous comment, this is pretty decent and can be used as effective removal in any deck that splashes black, without the drawback of [Angel of Jubilation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angel of Jubilation)'s ability crippling it.  
  
If you're playing mono-black, though, just use [Dismember](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dismember). It's more cost-effective.
